article:
'Walter Willard Taylor, Jr.' (1913 â€“ 1997) was an American anthropologist
and archaeologist most famous for his work at Coahuila in Mexico and his
"Conjunctive archaeology", a method of studying of the past combining elements
of both the traditional archaeology of the period and the allied field of
anthropology. This was exemplified by his work A Study of Archeology. W. W.
Taylor, 1948, American Anthropological Association, Memoir 69)
categories: American military personnel of World War II
University of Texas at Austin faculty
World War II prisoners of war held by Germany
Recipients of the Purple Heart medal
Recipients of the Bronze Star Medal
